|flash1type = <!-- Parallel,Serial(SPI),SPI NOR,NAND,Compact Flash, --> |fla1_num = <!-- 1,2,3,4 --> |fla1chip = Toshiba;TC58NVG1S3HBA16; |flash1size = 256 |flash1maxsize = <!-- Maximum size firmware can be in bytes -->
|ram1type = <!-- DDR,DDR2,DDR3,DDR4, --> |ram1type1 = <!-- SO-DIMM,SDRAM, --> |ram1spd = <!-- RAM speed --> |ram1size = 512 |ram1chip = Samsung;K4B4G1646E-BYK0; |ram1_num = <!-- Number of Ram chips --> |nvramsize = <!-- 32, 60, 64, etc... in kb, Leave blank for unknown -->
|eth_cpu = true |oui = F4:F5:D8

}}{{TIDTOC|embedded}} ==Overview== Manuf P/N: GA3A00417A14, GA00210-US (6C31AY523N) :{{WPLink|Google Home}}
*CPU: [[Marvell]] 88DE3006 ([[Synaptics]] BG2CDP) @1.2GHz :Dual Core ARM Cortex-A7 (Armada 1500 Mini Plus)
===Specifications=== *Supported Audio Formats: MP3, FLAC, :HE-AAC, LC-AAC+, Vorbis, WAV (LPCM) *Wireless: 802.11ac (2.4/5GHz) *Speaker: High excursion speaker with :2" driver + dual 2" passive radiators :Far-field voice recognition supports hands-free use *Ports & Connectors: DC power jack :Micro-USB port (for service only) *Power: Required 16.5V / 2A included
==Links of Interest== ===Reviews=== *[https://www.ifixit.com/Teardown/Google+Home+Teardown/72684 ''Google Home Teardown'' on '''iFixit'''] *[https://arstechnica.com/gadgets/2016/11/google-home-review-a-step-forward-for-hotwords-a-step-backward-in-capability/2/ ''Google Home Review'' on '''ArsTechnica''']
